div.p: “For the matter of it—I consent to much—I regret much—I blame or reject nothing. I should as soon think of finding fault with you as with a thundercloud or a nightshade blossom. All I can say of you or them—is that God made you, and that you are very wonderful and beautiful.”
—John Ruskin, from a letter to Swinburne, commenting on the poet’s Poems and Ballads.
